Key Match Events: Adolis García powered the Rangers to their first World Series since 2011 with an 11-4 rout of the Astros in Game 7 of the ALCS.
Corey Seager homered to right center (440 feet) in the 1st inning.
Adolis García singled to left, Carter scored in the 1st inning.
Mitch Garver singled to center, García scored, Garver to second in the 1st inning.
José Abreu singled to left, Altuve scored, Alvarez to third in the 1st inning.
Adolis García homered to right (368 feet) in the 3rd inning.
Alex Bregman homered to left center (393 feet) in the 3rd inning.
Evan Carter doubled to right, Jung scored and Semien scored, Seager to third in the 4th inning.
Adolis García singled to left, Seager scored and Carter scored in the 4th inning.
Nathaniel Lowe homered to right (358 feet), Garver scored in the 6th inning.
Yordan Alvarez singled to center, Bregman scored in the 7th inning.
Adolis García homered to left center (340 feet) in the 8th inning.
José Altuve homered to left (363 feet) in the 9th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Adolis García and these road-happy Rangers are not only tops in Texas, they're best in the American League.
